text: The Wright Commander was a single-decker body of a bus. It had a low-floor. It was made from 2002 to 2007 by Wrightbus. The Wright Commander body was built on the DAF/VDL SB200 chassis. In 2007, The Commander was replaced with the Pulsar. ==Operators== From 2002 to 2007, Arriva Midlands North ordered 288 Wright Commanders, 14 were used for services in Telford. 188 of these were exported to the Netherlands and changed to left-hand drive. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Low-floor buses Commander
title: Wright Commander
